intro: Heterotheca loboensis, commonly known as the Lobo's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear to lance-shaped, and it produces small, seed-like fruits called cypselae. Heterotheca loboensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
